data.title: 8 Day Trips from Quezon City in 2024
data.meta_description: Discover urban day trips from Quezon City. Explore historical sites, natural parks, and Metro Manila's culture.
data.text:
After indulging in all the things to do in Quezon City, from exploring the interactive exhibits at the Art in Island museum to unwinding in the tranquil La Mesa Eco Park, your quest for adventure doesn‚Äôt have to end within the city‚Äôs borders. Day trips from Quezon City unlock the door to further explorations in the Philippines, offering a mix of natural wonders, historical sites, and cultural experiences just a short drive away.

As you venture from Quezon City, you‚Äôre met with the vast array of things to do in the Philippines, such as marveling at the majestic Pagsanjan Falls, stepping back in time at the historic streets of Vigan, or soaking up the sun on the pristine beaches of Batangas. These excursions not only highlight the breathtaking beauty of the Philippines but also offer a deeper dive into the country‚Äôs rich cultural heritage and vibrant natural landscapes.

Choosing where to stay in Quezon City is essential for travelers looking to balance the urban excitement with the ease of accessing the natural and historical gems nearby. A strategically located accommodation provides not only comfort and convenience within the city but also serves as a perfect base for embarking on memorable day trips, ensuring a well-rounded experience of the Philippines‚Äô diverse attractions.

Discover Best Day Trips from Quezon City, Philippines

1. La Mesa Eco Park, Philippines

La Mesa Eco Park is a lush green oasis within the city, perfect for families and nature lovers. It‚Äôs only about 30 minutes away from Quezon City and offers a variety of outdoor activities.

Distance: Approximately 13 km

Travel Time: Approximately 30 minutes by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Outdoor activities, lush greenery, picnic areas

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Park Entrance: $1

Budget: Approximately $10-$20 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: La Mesa Dam, Butterfly Haven, Ecotrail

Travel Tip: Bring a picnic basket and enjoy a meal amidst the park‚Äôs natural beauty. The park is also great for photography enthusiasts.

2. Pinto Art Museum, Philippines

Pinto Art Museum in Antipolo offers a unique blend of art and nature, featuring contemporary Filipino artwork. The museum is around a 1-hour drive from Quezon City and is set in a beautiful garden.

Distance: Approximately 20 km

Travel Time: About 1 hour by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Contemporary Filipino artwork, beautiful gardens

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Museum Entrance: $5

Budget: Approximately $15-$25 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Art installations, garden pathways, hilltop views

Travel Tip: Visit on a weekday to avoid the crowds and have a more serene experience exploring the art and gardens.

3. Mount Daraitan, Philippines

Mount Daraitan, famous for its stunning landscapes and the Tinipak River, is a paradise for adventure seekers. Located approximately 3 hours from Quezon City, it‚Äôs ideal for hiking and camping.

Distance: Approximately 60 km

Travel Time: Roughly 3 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Stunning landscapes, Tinipak River, hiking trails

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Hiking Permit: $2

Guide Fee: $10 (optional)

Budget: Approximately $20-$40 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Tinipak River, Daraitan Peak, caves and rock formations

Travel Tip: Hire a local guide for the hike to ensure safety and to learn more about the area‚Äôs natural wonders.

4. Masungi Georeserve, Philippines

Masungi Georeserve is an eco-park and conservation area known for its unique karst landscapes and suspended trails. The travel time from Quezon City is about 2 hours, making it a great choice for an adventurous day out.

Distance: Approximately 47 km

Travel Time: Around 2 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Unique karst landscapes, suspended trails, conservation area

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Guided Tour: $35

Budget: Approximately $50-$70 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Sapot (Spider Web) trail, Duyan (Hammock) trail, Yungib (Cave) trail

Travel Tip: Book your visit in advance as the reserve limits the number of visitors per day to preserve its natural state.

5. Villa Escudero Plantations, Philippines

Villa Escudero Plantations offers a glimpse into the Philippines‚Äô colonial past and is about 2.5 hours from Quezon City. The plantation features a museum, traditional houses, and a unique waterfall restaurant.

Distance: Approximately 100 km

Travel Time: Approximately 2.5 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Colonial plantation, museum, waterfall restaurant

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Day Tour: $20 (including lunch)

Budget: Approximately $40-$60 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Waterfall restaurant, traditional houses, coconut plantation

Travel Tip: Don‚Äôt miss the chance to dine at the waterfall restaurant for a unique experience.

6. Hidden Valley Springs, Philippines

Hidden Valley Springs, located around 2 hours from Quezon City, is a tropical rainforest paradise with natural springs and pools. It‚Äôs perfect for a relaxing day in nature.

Distance: Approximately 75 km

Travel Time: About 2 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Natural springs, tropical rainforest, swimming pools

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Entrance Fee: $25

Budget: Approximately $40-$60 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Thermal pools, waterfalls, forest trails

Travel Tip: Bring swimwear to enjoy the thermal waters, and don‚Äôt forget a waterproof camera.

7. Taal Heritage Town, Philippines

Taal Heritage Town, about a 2.5-hour drive from Quezon City, is known for its well-preserved Spanish colonial architecture and historic landmarks. It provides a rich cultural experience.

Distance: Approximately 110 km

Travel Time: Roughly 2.5 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Spanish colonial architecture, historic landmarks

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Ancestral House Tours: $3

Budget: Approximately $30-$50 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Basilica of St. Martin of Tours, ancestral houses, Taal Park

Travel Tip: Explore the Basilica of St. Martin of Tours, the largest church in Asia, and visit the various ancestral houses turned into museums.

8. Hundred Islands National Park, Philippines

Hundred Islands National Park in Alaminos, Pangasinan, is a 4-hour drive from Quezon City. The park features 124 islands, ideal for island hopping, snorkeling, and enjoying pristine beaches.

Distance: Approximately 240 km

Travel Time: Around 4 hours by car

Transportation: Car (GetRentacar.com)

Main Attractions: Island hopping, snorkeling, pristine beaches

Best Time to Visit: Year-round

Entrance Fees:

Island Hopping Tour: $25

Budget: Approximately $50-$100 (including transportation, entrance fees, and food)

Scenic Spots: Governor‚Äôs Island, Quezon Island, Children‚Äôs Island

Travel Tip: Rent a boat for island hopping early in the day to make the most of your trip and avoid the afternoon heat.
